channel.title: Comments on: From protovis to d3

item.title: By: jerome
item.dc:creator: jerome
item.description: Hi, actually what I meant is that in protovis, to set height, you need to use the .height() method, to set width, you need to use the .width method... all of which are distinct. However, with d3, all such attributes are set with the same method, .attr() - be this height, width, fill, etc.
item.content:encoded:
Hi, actually what I meant is that in protovis, to set height, you need to use the .height() method, to set width, you need to use the .width method… all of which are distinct.
However, with d3, all such attributes are set with the same method, .attr() – be this height, width, fill, etc.

item.title: By: kerry
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.description: Where you have "In protovis, it is inherently" I think you mean "In D3..."
item.content:encoded: Where you have “In protovis, it is inherently” I think you mean “In D3…”
